content.question: An elevator at rest at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> begins moving upward with a constant, positive acceleration. Which of the following graphs could represent the linear momentum <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>p</mi></math> of the elevator as a function of time?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a line segment in a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled p. The line segment begins near the top of the vertical axis and extends horizontally to the right until it ends.

The figure shows the graph of a line segment in a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled p. The line segment begins at the origin and slants upward and to the right until it ends.

The figure shows the graph of a line segment in a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled p. The line segment begins on the vertical axis, slightly above the origin, and slants upward and to the right until it ends.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled p. The curve begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right at an increasing rate.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a line segment in a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled p. The line segment begins at the origin and slants upward and to the right until it ends.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
